MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
OF AGRICULTURE AND APPLIED SCIENCE • EAST LANSING
TELEVISION STATION • WKAR-TV
April 16, 1958
/
Mr. Sam L. Becker
Director, Division of TV-Radio-?ilm
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
Keith tells me that you will not he able to attend the Institute this year.
I am very sorry to hear this because I looked forward to seeing you again,
and also because I am stuck with the chairmanship of the clinic. I thought
you would be interested in knowing what we have planned.
We have decided to center the discussion around the four following areas:
1. Significant recent research in U. S. commercial broadcasting.
2. A review of the NAEB seminar on educational broadcast research.
3. Recent developments in CBC research.
4. A report on the outstanding broadcast research study completed
within the past year.
Bor point #2, if it meets with your approval, I plan to ask Ken Harwood to
review the WEB seminar.
I might note that we do not plan to bill point #4 as the outstanding broad¬
cast study, but will simply have a study reported on. I would be most happy
to receive by return mail your suggestion as to which study should be pre¬
sented.
Sincerely,
Irving R. Merrill
Director of Television Research
IEM/edm
